STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ROBERT GORDON
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
October 19, 2020
Renee Adorjan
Washtenaw County DHHS
22 Center St.
Ypsilanti, MI 48198
RE: License #: CP810201490
Washtenaw County DHHS
22 Center St.
Ypsilanti, MI 48198
Dear Mrs. Adorjan:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
10/16/2020. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should
be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the ISEP
and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter
and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or ISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular certificate of approval
license will be issued. If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan,
disciplinary action will result.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.
Sincerely,
Vivian D. Malleck, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
4th Floor, Suite 4B
51111 Woodward Avenue
Pontiac, MI 48342
(248) 860-3284
enclosure
2

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
RENEWAL INSPECTION REPORT

Services

Lansing, MI 48902

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12324 Reevaluation.
(8) An agency shall complete a reevaluation and shall make
a licensing recommendation to the department at least 15
calendar days before the expiration date of the foster home
license.
One of six reevaluations reviewed did not make a licensing
recommendation to the department at least 15 calendar
days before the expiration date of the foster home license.
The reevaluation was completed 01/27/2020 and the foster
home license expiration date was 01/29/2020.
R 400.12326 Borrowed home.
(1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by
another agency or tribe, the agency shall have a record
containing all of the following documents:
(a) Prior approval from the certifying agency authorizing
the placement of a child in the home.
One of one borrowed home file reviewed did not have
documentation showing prior approval from the certifying
agency authorizing the placement of a child in the home.
The child was placed on 02/20/2020 and the approval
documentation was signed and dated 03/02/2020.
R 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy.
(1) An agency's medical and dental care policy shall, at a
minimum, include all of the following:
(c) A physical examination for each child as follows,
unless a greater frequency is medically indicated:
(i) For a child under 2 years of age, a physical
examination shall have been completed within 3 months
before being placed in foster care or a new physical
examination shall be completed within 30 calendar days
after being placed in foster care.
(ii) For a child 2 years of age or older, a physical
examination shall have been completed within 12 months
before placement or a new physical examination shall be
completed within 30 calendar days after placement.
4

(iii) A physical examination every 14 months.
One of six foster care files reviewed did not have a current
physical examination. The foster care file did not have a
well child exam.
R 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy.
(1) An agency's medical and dental care policy shall, at a
minimum, include all of the following:
(d) Current immunizations for each child as required by
section 5111 of 1978 PA 368, MCL 333.5111. All of the
following apply:
(i) A statement from a parent or licensed medical
authority which indicates that immunizations are current or
contraindicated is sufficient documentation of
immunizations.
(ii) A copy of a waiver addressed to the department of
community health signed by the parent stating
immunizations are not being administered due to religious,
medical, or other reasons is sufficient documentation of
immunizations.
(iii) If documentation of immunization or a copy of the
waiver is unavailable, then immunizations shall begin within
30 calendar days of placement.
Two of six foster care files reviewed did not have up to date
immunizations. One foster child was overdue for
Meningococcal B on 10/25/2019 and another foster child
was overdue for Diphtheria, Tetanus, Pertussis and
Meningococcal Conjugate on 08/22/2020.
REPEAT VIOLATION from 11/04/2019 interim inspection
Corrective action plan approved 11/27/2019
R 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy.
(1) An agency's medical and dental care policy shall, at a
minimum, include all of the following:
(f) The provision of a dental examination and any
treatment required for each child who is 4 years of age and
older, including both of the following:
(i) A dental examination within 12 months before
placement or a new dental examination shall be completed
not more than 90 calendar days after placement.
5

(ii) A dental reexamination shall be obtained at least
every 18 months, unless a greater frequency is indicated.
One of six foster care files reviewed did not contain a dental
examination.
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(6) Service plans shall be signed by the social services
worker and the social services supervisor.
One of twelve service plans reviewed was not signed and
dated by the social services worker and social services
supervisor.
R 400.12507 Medical/dental and mental health care.
(1) An agency shall ensure that a youth in independent
living receives any needed medical, dental, and mental
health care as required in R 400.12413. Medical, dental,
and mental health care provided shall be documented in the
youth's record.
Three of three independent living files reviewed did not
have up to date immunizations. One resident was overdue
for Meningococcal B on 07/12/2018 and Meningococcal
conjugate on 06/12/0219. Another resident was overdue for
Meningococcal B on 06/17/2019. Another resident was
overdue for Meningococcal B on 03/03/2018.
REPEAT VIOLATION from 11/04/2019 interim inspection
Corrective action plan approved 11/27/2019
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional ISEP requirements except for the following: In
compliance.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following: In compliance.
6

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
 Follow Children Service Administration guidelines for Covid 19 precautions.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
 None at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There was one incident of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period. This investigation also led to one incident of substantiated child abuse and/or
neglect during this licensing period.
 2020C0628792 found the foster parent in violation of R 400.9201 Foster
parent qualifications (d) Demonstrate an understanding of the care which
must be provided to the children served by the agency. (j) Be of responsible
charged and be suitable and able to meet the needs of children and provide
for their care, supervision, and protection. Also, found in violation of
R 400.9404 Behavior management (3) A foster parent shall not use corporal
punishment for any reason with a foster child. Washtenaw Department of
Health and Human Services removed the foster child immediately from the
foster home and initiated an investigation. Revocation of the foster home is
recommended based on the finding that the foster parent physically
disciplined a child in his care.
Washtenaw Department of Health and Human Services submitted two acceptable
corrective action plans not related to maltreatment during this licensing period.
 2019C0217055 cited R 400.12303 Policy and procedure when the agency
delayed the processing of an enrolled foster home by requiring two
applications and failing to complete clearances timely. This issue is resolved
because it is an isolated incident.
 Interim inspection dated 11/04/2019 resulted in a corrective action plan.
Compliance is met except for the two repeat citations about immunizations in
this report.
Washtenaw County Department of Health and Human Services Safety alert
 DCWL analyst, Kim Hatch, was unable to visit a foster home due to Covid
19. A courtesy video was completed and video tapes of the home were
provided to the analyst. A safety alert was completed due to a blanket
observed hanging on the side of the crib and a possible nonworking
carbon monoxide detector. Washtenaw Department of Health and Human
7

Service verified on 08/19/2020 and 09/22/2020 that the home is in
compliance with licensing rules. The social service worker did not find
safety issues and a new carbon monoxide detector was tested and found
functioning.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will
be issued a renewal of their regular license.
10/19/2020
________________________________________
Vivian D. Malleck Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
October 20, 2020
________________________________________
Linda D. Tansil Date
Area Manager
